label: indra sóma-ḥ kṛ-tā́ dhānā́ át-tave te hári-bhyāṃ
trs: The Barhis has been strewn for thee, O Indra; the Soma  has been pressed (into an extract). The barley grains  have been prepared for thy two bay-horses to eat.' (Ṛgveda 3.35.7)

trs: It (the Soma) has been washed  by men, pressed with the help of stones, strained with  wool-filters.' (Ṛgveda 8.2.2)

label: sva-iḥ pitāmaha-iḥ
trs: Jaratkāru went to heaven accompanied by his ancestors.' (Mahābhārata 1.130.43c)

label: paesa-m
trs: And King  Seṇiya reached that place.' (Vasudevahiṃḍī KH. 17.1)

label: taṇadabbhaparichinn-o diṭ-ṭho

label: \#kiṃ vālu ṇa ḍaĩk-ai uragamaṇu\#
trs: Does the young (rising) sun not destroy darkness? Does the young fire (spark) not burn down the forest? Does a young lion (cub) not shatter the elephant? Does the young snake not bite?' (Paumacariu  2.21.6.9)

label: etad brav-īmi te
trs: The Lord alone reigns [over time and death and this universe of mobile and immobile objects], this truth I tell you.' (Mahābhārata 5.66.13c)\footnote{The previous line of verse completes the translation: kālasya ca hi mṛtyoś ca jaṇgamasthāvarasya ca  (Mahābhārata 5.66.13a)}
